parents.link_info_l: Attention mechanism allows  to search relevant parts in the context at each step of the output generation.
introduce a RNN architecture to map squence to sequence

ESN use reservior computing to set the recurrent weights; Only the output weights need to be learnt.

fullname: echo state networks with leaky integration units

parents.link_info_l: An extension to echo state networks by adding leaky integration units

fullname: recurrent neural units with time skip connections

parents.link_info_l: To address long-term dependency, it adds direct connections from variables in the distant past to variables in the present.
Time skip connections add edges, so the units can choose to operate on a long time scale or focus on a short one; Removing connections force units to operate the long time scale.
To address long-term dependency, leaky units add linear self connections with weights near one.

Leaky units are units  with linear self-connections and a weight near one on these connections; Leaky units are more smooth and flexible than skip time connections since it adjust the real-valed weight rather than the integer-valued time skip.
LSTM uses a gated self-loop to learn long-term dependencies
LSTM and leaky units adopt different methods to accumulate information through time.

in the simple recurrent unit architecture, the majority of computation of each step is independent of the recurrence and can be easily parallelized; simple recurrent unit is as fas as a convolutional layer and 5-10x faster than an optimized LSTM
The gates of a recureent uit is redesigned in GRU, input gate and forget gate are combined into one update gate; GRU improves computation effiency
LRU decouples the GRU to two dimensions; LRU enables better convergence and accuracy
gridLSTM arranges LSTM cells in a multidimensional grid that can be applied to vectors, sequences or higher dimensional data
Generalize RNN from chain-like structure to tree-like structure; Improve the ability to represent hierarchical information

fullname: tree structured long short term memory

parents.link_info_l: a generalization of LSTMs from chain-structured to tree-structured network topologies; ; Improve the ability to represent hierarchical information
build a recursive neural networks with LSTM cells
an extension of LSTM to use a depth gate to connect memory cells of adjacent layers
use the stacked architecture; add gated skip connection

extract the feature maps from the entire image only once and apply the spatial pyramid pooling on each candidate windows; can run orders of magnitude faster

combine classification and bounding box regression into a multi-task leaning manner; training is a single-stage using a multi-task loss; improve the detection speed
use convolutional feature maps to compute region proposals with a deep convolutional neural network
add adding batch on all of the convolutional layers; remove the fully connected layers from YOLO and use anchor boxes to predict bounding boxes
use anchor boxes proposed in faster R-CNN
simultaneously predicting the bounding box and the class as it processes the image; no object proposal network

use a set of default anchor boxes with different aspect ratios and scales to discretize the output space of bounding boxes; predict based on multiple feature maps with different resolutions; predict the offset of boxes
combine ReseNet with SSD; use deconvolution layers to introduce additional large-scale context and improve accuracy
learn object detectors without pretrain; use dense layer-wise connection; use stem blocks inspired by inception
compute a multi-scale feature representation using a feature pyramid network
reuse the higher-resolution maps of the feature hierarchy
no costly per-region RoI-wise subnetwork; region-based detector is fully convolutional with almost all computation shared on the entire image
use concatenation instead of addition to fusion the information of previous tensor and up-sampling tensor; use FC layer to connect encoder and decoder
the decoder uses pooling indices computed in the max-pooling step of the corresponding encoder to perform non-linear upsampling; significantly smaller in the number of trainable parameters
change the convolution layer to deconvolution layer during up-sampling
use convolution layers for down sample and upsample operation; use residual blocks;  propose a ‘pyramid supervision’ training scheme
both use residual blocks; propose chained residual pooling; propose multi-path refinement
use dilated convolutions; no downsampling or upsampling
propose pyramid pooling module to aggregate the context; use auxiliary loss as intermediate supervision
use dense Conditional Random Field (CRF) to replace the softmax layer
